channel.title: World News - Breaking international news and headlines | Sky News

image.title: World News - Breaking international news and headlines | Sky News

channel.description: The latest international news from Sky, featuring top stories from around the world and breaking news, as it happens.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2021, Sky UK. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: How Russian shelling has wreaked destruction on Azovstal steelworks over course of war
item.description: New satellite images of the Azovstal steelworks in Mariupol show how the site has been the target of extensive shelling over the course of the war.
item.media:description: The left image shows the Azovstal plant on March 10 and the image on the right hand side shows the steelworks on May 1st. Credit: Planet

item.title: Hungary puts EU's ban on Russian oil in jeopardy
item.description: Hungary has warned it cannot accept the EU's planned ban on Russian oil as it would amount to an "atomic bomb" for its economy, threatening to scupper the bloc's sixth sanctions package against Moscow.
item.media:description: General view of the Petrolchemie und Kraftstoffe (PCK) oil refinary in Schwedt/Oder, October 20, 2014. There is no need to panic at the recent collapse in oil prices, the secretary general of OPEC said October 29, 2014, saying low prices would curb competing supplies and require the group to pump far more by the end of the decade. Picture taken ocotnber 20. REUTERS/Axel Schmidt (GERMANY - Tags: ENERGY BUSINESS CITYSCAPE BUSINESS COMMODITIES)

item.title: Russian losses in fight for steelworks 'frustrating' plans to capture Donbas
item.description: The Russian assault on the last defenders at Mariupol's steelworks will continue to hold back its plans to control the Donbas region, according to the UK Ministry of Defence.
item.media:description: Azovstal steel plant complex, amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, in Mariupol, Ukraine. Pic: Azov Regiment

item.title: Apartment block collapse in China kills 53 people
item.description: Fifty-three people are confirmed to have died after the rear of a six-storey building suddenly collapsed in China.
item.media:description: Rescue workers carry a survivor on a stretcher more than 131 hours after a building collapsed in Changsha, Hunan province, China, early May 5, 2022

item.title: Woman who poked holes in partner's condoms guilty of sexual assault
item.description: A German woman has been found guilty of sexual assault after poking holes in her partner's condoms in an attempt to get pregnant, according to reports.

item.title: At least eight dead and dozens injured after explosion at hotel in Cuba, officials say
item.description: At least eight people have died and dozens injured after a powerful explosion at a five-star hotel in the downtown area of Cuba's capital Havana, officials have said.

item.title: Sri Lanka could descend into 'anarchy' as it 'risks running out of food and fuel'
item.description: Sri Lanka could descend into "anarchy" as it faces the risk of running out of fuel and food in the next month, the country's former energy minster has said.
item.media:description: Sri Lanka students run from tear gas during a protest outside parliament in the capital

item.title: Activist whose Ryanair jet was forced to land in 'air piracy' incident jailed in Belarus
item.description: A woman detained after her Ryanair flight was forced to land in Belarus last May has been jailed for six years.
item.media:description: Russian citizen Sofia Sapega, who was detained in Minsk with her dissident boyfriend Roman Protasevich after their commercial flight was forced to land in Belarus last year, attends a court hearing in Grodno, Belarus

item.title: Pope approved secret €1m bid to free kidnapped nun, says disgraced cardinal
item.description: The Pope approved a secret €1m operation to free a Colombian nun kidnapped in Mali, a disgraced cardinal has claimed.
item.media:description: The Pope signed off on the rescue plan, the cardinal told the court

item.title: Cocaine found in coffee sent to Swiss Nespresso factory
item.description: More than 500kg of cocaine has been discovered in a shipment of coffee beans sent to a Nespresso factory, according to Swiss police.
item.media:description: Cocaine and coffee bags seized at the Nespresso plant in Romont, Switzerland
